ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So it was. Yet We bequeathed these things to another people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Thus it was; and We passed them on to another people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Thus it was; and We made another people inherit all that.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We gave these as an inheritance to other people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: That is what We did; and We made another nation their heirs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Thus (it was)! And We made other people inherit them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Thus (it was), and We gave them as a heritage to another people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Even so; and We bequeathed them upon another people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Even so (it was), and We made it an inheritance for other folk;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Such was their end, and what had been theirs We gave to other people to inherit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Even so And We caused to inherit them another people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So it was; and We bequeathed them to another people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Thus (was their end)! And We made other people inherit (those things)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Thus (it was)! And We made other people inherit them (i.e. We made the Children of Israel to inherit the kingdom of Egypt).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: As such (it was). And We made other people inherit them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So it was; and We passed it on to another people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Thus. And We caused to inherit it another people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [44:28] So [it was] (kadhālika is the predicate of a subject [that is missing], such as ‘the matter was [so]’) and We made these an inheritance, that is to say, their riches, for another people, namely, the Children of Israel.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Even so (it was)) We destroyed them, (and We made it an inheritance for other folk) We made the Children of Israel inherit all that after they were destroyed;
